name: BTDFProjectFileUpdater
description: Modifies the Product Version, Project Version and Product ID in the BTDFProj file prior to creating the MSI.
author: Rob Loach

inputs.name: MethodOfVersionNumber
inputs.label: Method of versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This will generate an MSI compatible version.

If you choose 'Use an environment variable', you must select an environment variable and ensure it contains the version number you want to use.

If you choose 'Use the build number', this will use the build number to version your package. **Note:** Under Options set the build number format to be '[$(BuildDefinitionName)_$(Year:yyyy).$(Month).$(DayOfMonth)$(Rev:.r)](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=627416)' or the version format of your choosing.

If you choose 'Use properties from GitVersion', then properties generated from GitVersion will be used.  Read more about [GitVersion](https://gitversion.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) and [SemVer](http://semver.org/spec/v1.0.0.html) for more information.

inputs.name: VersionNumberEnvVar
inputs.label: Environment variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the variable name without $, $env, or %.

inputs.name: CombinePatchBuildNumbers
inputs.label: Combine the Patch and Build Numbers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Combine the Patch and Build Numbers into one number from Major.Minor.Patch.Build.

inputs.name: UpdateProjectVersion
inputs.label: Update the Project Version as well as Product Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Updates the Project Version as well as the Product Version. This allows generated start menu items to be unique across versions.
